The Chapter with Kaccāyana
The Elder Mahākoṭṭhita’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
the sage who knows all the worlds;
A hundred thousand eons from now,
the one with vision will appear.
The one who instructs and teaches,
the star for all living beings;
The Buddha who is skilled in teaching,
he will liberate many people.🔽The one with compassion and pity,
the one who benefits all living beings;
When all the sectarians have arrived,
he will establish them in the five precepts.

original: Evaṁ nirākulaṁ āsi,🔽suññataṁ titthiyehi ca;🔽Vicittaṁ arahantehi,
analyzed: evam nirākulam āsi  suññatam titthiyehi ca  vicittam arahantehi
translated: Thus it will be free of trouble,🔽empty of sectarians;🔽It will be adorned with Worthy Ones,
those who have attained mastery, those who are peaceful.
There will be fifty-eight treasures,
that great sage will appear;
He will be golden-colored,
with thirty-two excellent marks.
His lifespan will be a thousand years,
that will be the extent;
While he remains for that long,
he will liberate many people.
At that time, in Haṁsavati,
I was a brahmin who had mastered the Vedas;
I approached the foremost in the world
and listened to the teaching of the Dhamma.
At that time, that hero’s disciple,
whose sphere was the penetration of wisdom,
In the Dhamma and in the Vinaya,
and in the answers to the questions.
He placed him in the foremost position,
having heard that, I was delighted;
For seven days I fed the Victor, the foremost of men,
together with his disciples.
Having covered the Buddha, the ocean of wisdom,
and his disciples with a canopy,
I made a wish at his feet,
for that place, radiant like the interior of a lotus.
Then the foremost of men said,
‘Look at this one, the most excellent of men,

with a mind of loving-kindness, mindful and composed,🔽I attended on the Victor.
By the ripening of that deed,
by intention and aspiration,
having given up the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

translated: Three times I was king of the gods,

An extensive regional kingdom,

I transmigrate through two existences,

I do not go to another realm,

I am born into two families,
among the nobles and among the brahmins;
I am not born into a low family,
this is the fruit of well-done deeds.
In my last existence,
I was a kinsman of Brahmā;
in Sāvatthī, in a wealthy family,
I was reborn in a distinguished family.
My mother was named Candavatī,
my father was called Assalāyana;

I was trained in all the purity.
Then I was pleased with the One Happy in the Heart,🔽I went forth from the home to homelessness;
Moggallāna was my teacher,
Sāriputta was my preceptor.
When my hair was being cut,
my view was cut down by the root;
I lived in the ochre robe,
and attained Liberation.
In the meaning, the Dhamma, the phrasing,
and in the inspired speech my mind was (set at rest);
The Leader of the World declared me,
he placed me at the head of those with inspired speech.
I explained without seeing (the Buddha),
when asked by Upatissa;
In the inspired speech I am foremost,
in the Dispensation of the Sambuddha.
My defilements are burnt up,
I live undefiled.
It was good for me,
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.
